summary: This is an email from Judge Nathan's chambers distributing a signed order in the case United States v. Maxwell (20-cr-330) to the legal counsel involved. The order was to be entered into the public docket the following morning.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: The email is sent from their chambers, and they signed the attached order in the case United States v. Maxwell.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Identified as the Honorable judge whose chambers sent the email and who signed the order.

persons.name: CEverdell
persons.context: Email recipient, appears to be an attorney at Cohen Gresser.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Email recipient, appears to be an attorney at Hueston Hennigan (based on email domain).

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Email recipient, appears to be an attorney at Haddon, Morgan and Foreman.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced (United States v. Maxwell).

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against Maxwell.
CEverdell is among the legal counsel receiving the court order, indicating representation in the case.
Pagliuca is among the legal counsel receiving the court order, indicating representation in the case.
Menninger is among the legal counsel receiving the court order, indicating representation in the case.

events.title: Court Order Issued in Maxwell Case
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan signs an order in the criminal case United States v. Maxwell (20-cr-330).

keyFacts: The document is an email distributing a court order signed by Judge Alison J. Nathan.
The order pertains to the ongoing criminal case United States v. Maxwell (docket number 20-cr-330).
The email is addressed to multiple members of the legal defense team for Ghislaine Maxwell.
The order was to be entered into the public docket on the morning of April 22, 2021.
This communication demonstrates standard court procedure for distributing rulings to counsel in a high-profile case.
